citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Expired bottles of reversal agents, atipamezole, and naltrexone, expired on 11/08/2021, were used for the successful
recovery of camel anesthesia on 10/18/23. While the anesthetic was successfully reversed, the use of expired drugs is
not in accordance with established standards of veterinary practice. The facility must ensure that veterinary care is given
in accordance with established veterinary medical and nursing practices.
Correct from this date forward, 19 October, 2023.

One rabbit was housed with a nervous Patagonian cavy to provide a calming companion, on veterinary authority,. One
rabbit was housed with two goats to provide social enrichment, as the rabbit is aggressive with other rabbits, on veterinary
authority. Unless required for scientific reasons, rabbits may only be housed with other rabbits. The facility shall ensure
that rabbit housing is compliant with the regulations.
Correct from 10/24/2023 forward.

Power cords to heating pads in pig and muntjac enclosures were unprotected and accessible to the animals. Electrical
cords may injure animals if they are chewed or damaged, or the animals accidentally become entangled. The facility must
ensure that animals are protected from injury from electrical cords.
Correct by 23 October 2023.

Refrigerators and freezers used to store food for the animals had extensive black patches of material (dirt/mold) on the
seals of the doors. Contamination of these door seals may lead to contamination of the diet, or impair the function of the
seal in preserving correct temperatures to prevent deterioration of food. The facility must ensure food is stored adequately
to prevent contamination and deterioration.
Correct by 23 October 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(5) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Expired bottles of reversal agents, atipamezole, and naltrexone, expired on 11/08/2021, were used for the successful 
recovery of camel anesthesia on 10/18/23. While the anesthetic was successfully reversed, the use of expired drugs is 
not in accordance with established standards of veterinary practice. The facility must ensure that veterinary care is given 
in accordance with established veterinary medical and nursing practices.  
 
Correct from this date forward, 19 October, 2023. 
3.58(a) 
   
Classification and separation. 
One rabbit was housed with a nervous Patagonian cavy to provide a calming companion, on veterinary authority,. One 
rabbit was housed with two goats to provide social enrichment, as the rabbit is aggressive with other rabbits, on veterinary 
authority. Unless required for scientific reasons, rabbits may only be housed with other rabbits. The facility shall ensure 
that rabbit housing is compliant with the regulations. 
 
Correct from 10/24/2023 forward. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Power cords to heating pads in pig and muntjac enclosures were unprotected and accessible to the animals. Electrical 
cords may injure animals if they are chewed or damaged, or the animals accidentally become entangled. The facility must 
ensure that animals are protected from injury from electrical cords. 
 
Correct by 23 October 2023. 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general.

Refrigerators and freezers used to store food for the animals had extensive black patches of material (dirt/mold) on the 
seals of the doors. Contamination of these door seals may lead to contamination of the diet, or impair the function of the 
seal in preserving correct temperatures to prevent deterioration of food. The facility must ensure food is stored adequately 
to prevent contamination and deterioration. 
 
Correct by 23 October 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
